question: 青葉
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>young</kanji> <kanji>leaf</kanji> is exactly what you'd expect, although most people usually just call them <vocabulary>fresh leaves</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings for the kanji in this word are the kun'yomi readings. Since you've already seen the word <ja>青</ja>, hopefully you can just combine it with <ja>葉</ja> (you learned the reading for this part with the kanji). Be sure to pay attention to the rendaku, though. <ja>は</ja> goes to <ja>ば</ja> in this word, making it <ja><reading>あおば</reading></ja>.
